response:
The combination of optic neuropathy and cerebellar dysfunction in a 41-year-old patient is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating CNS disorder. The presence of a concurrent UTI (positive nitrites) may be causing a pseudo-relapse or triggering a true relapse. Other inflammatory, infectious, and paraneoplastic etiologies must be considered.
